answers.question: Telegram Handle We Can Use To Contact You
Link to your Public Group Chat

answers.answer:
VoiceDeck has taken part in hypercerts and open civics community rounds

We have also been in the core rounds since the gitcoin beta round
answers.question: Have you participated in a previous Gitcoin Grants Round? If so, please name the rounds or link the builder profile associated with previous rounds.

answers.answer:
1. VoiceDeck is one of the flagship open source dapps built on the hypercerts standard, leading the charge in figuring out new ways of outcome based funding onchain

2. The GainForest team forked the VoiceDeck app to launch their own marketplace for hypercerts in the environmental domain. They even have a GG23 community round for people to quadratically fund their ecocerts!

3. Broadly, outcome based funding should become a norm for funding open source software. By creating this funding mechanism, we can apply lessons learnt back to the OSS ecosystem.

For example, deepfunding.org is an initiative to fund the core ethereum dependencies with AI. It is a spin out from VoiceDeck based on smarter ways of quantifying impact of open source repos.
answers.question: How does your project contribute to the growth of the OSS ecosystem? Please provide specific examples of how your application enhances or expands the current ecosystem.

answers.answer:
1. We are seeing a movement towards quantifying impact, especially with the help of AI. VoiceDeck is unique in quantifying all the outcomes that are sold on the app.voicedeck.org marketplace. Generally, it is easier to quantify past outcomes than prospective future work.

2. VoiceDeck has a clear path to integrating organizations and communities into web3: record your past impact onchain so that it cannot be sold multiple times.

Reward these outcomes to support its creators to do more impactful work.

3. VoiceDeck is also innovative in linking web2 and web3. We recently integrated credit card payments into our marketplace, expanding the target base to those outside web3.
answers.question: What features or use cases does your dApp/App present? How is it differentiated?

answers.answer:
Our main focus now is connecting the accountability that comes from retroactive funding with the excitement of funding future impact.

We want to modify our CMS to accept not just past impact but also first information reports that have a high chance of converting to impact in the near term.

So we would use grant funds to record such stories, get an action team to work on their conversion to some outcome and then point to the tangible civic impact achieved in the next gitcoin round
answers.question: What are your plans for further development, and how will the grant funds be used to achieve these goals?

answers.question: For any project deploying smart contracts on blockchain networks, please list all your deployer addresses and their corresponding blockchain networks. Use this format for each entry: [deployer_address], [chain_id]—for example, 0x123abc..., 42161 (This represents a deployer address on the Arbitrum network). Please include a separate line for each unique deployer address and blockchain combination.

project.title: VoiceDeck: A Marketplace for Impact Certificates
project.description:
VoiceDeck is an outcome based online donation platform

**Progress Bar**

* Outcomes already achieved by organizations are recorded as hypercerts so that donors can directly buy the outcomes they think are impactful, putting the focus on work done rather than trustworthiness of organization doing the work

* Each outcome has a fixed price to prevent donors from overpaying. On VoiceDeck, organizations cannot raise more money than the impact they have created.

* Since launching on October 18 2024, we have had $138 in purchases from 16 donors to support civic activists in India with a history of outcomes

* We have had a significant [fork](https://github.com/VoiceDeck) of our approach, with GainForest.Earth launching [‘Ecocertain’](https://www.ecocertain.xyz/) (a marketplace to fund environmental impact) & hosting their own community round this GG ‘23 cycle

* VoiceDeck’s work has been documented as a [peer reviewed paper](https://dl.acm.org/doi/10.1145/3678884.3687146) at ACM CSCW and a [blog post](https://nxbn.ethereum.foundation/fellowship/Devansh) on the Ethereum website

**What’s Next?**

* In partnership with [Normie Tech](https://normie.tech/), as of March 30 2025, the option to pay with fiat (credit/debit cards/Paypal) is enabled, allowing donors beyond web3 to donate seamlessly

* The Organized Crime & Corruption Reporting Project ([OCCRP](https://www.occrp.org/en)) has reached out to have their key stories, including reporting on the Panama papers, listed & evaluated on VoiceDeck as impact certificates for purchase

* Multiple donors have said they prefer donating to an ongoing cause rather than one already achieved, so we are working to integrate a prospective funding mechanism with retroactive impact certificates, wherein:

* We list stories that haven't yet converted to an impact for donors to fund

Example: an investigative report exposing the deplorable & unusable state of roads in a neighbourhood in Bombay

* We use the money raised to pay an action team that works on ground to ensure the story creates an impact

Example: the action team pressures the local government & associated bodies & takes all measures necessary to get the road fixed & resolve the issue raised in the story within a timeframe

* Once an investigation causes some tangible outcome it gets listed as an impact certificate to close the loop for donors

* We know from our experience working with the citizen journalism outlet CGNet Swara in Central India that currently only 10% of stories result in impact. Our main KPI with this approach is increasing the conversion rate propelling information reports on civic problems to concrete solutions impacting communities
